title: Edie Adams - That's All (I Love Lucy Series Finale)
description:
From the episode, "Lucy Meets the Moustache" of the Lucy-Desi Comedy Hour.  The song meant so much more since it was the last episode of the popular I Love Lucy series. Lucy and Desi were also divorcing after a long tumultuous marriage. They still loved each other very much, but the problems that plagued the marriage couldn't keep them together. However, they remained friends even after they married other people, and when Desi died, Lucy was devastated. So in a sense, this song was meaningful for them both. All that they could give each other was love....that's all.

The last lines of the show....

Lucy: "Honey, honey, I just wanted to help."

Ricky: "From now on, you can help me by not trying to help me. But thanks, anyway."

---

That's All
Lyrics & Music by Alan Brandt and Bob Haymes, 1952
[brackets indicate Edie Adams' variation on the song]

I can only give you love that lasts forever
And a [the] promise to be near each time you call
And the only heart I own for you and you alone
That's all, that's all

I can only give you country walks in springtime
And a hand to hold when leaves begin to fall
And a love whose burning light will warm the winter night
That's all, that's all

There are those I am sure [who] have told you
They would give you the world for a toy
All I have are these arms to enfold you
And a love even time can't destroy
[And a love time can never destroy]

If you're wondering what I'm asking in return, dear
You'll be glad to know that my demands are small
Say it's me that you'll adore for now and evermore
That's all, that's all

[the following are not part of the original composition and what makes Edie Adams' version so special and unique]

I love you
Yes, I love you
That's all....

---

title: I Love Lucy   Down the Line of Translation
Funeral for television legend Desi Arnaz in 1986, Lucille Ball remembers her former husband
description:
December 4, 1986 The funeral of television legend Desi Arnaz. Lucille Ball, Gary Morton, Desi Arnaz Jr., Lucie Arnaz, and Danny Thomas were among the mourners. Lucy told CBS 8 that her former husband was a great showman, musician, father, and husband and he was a great part of the innovation in this business. Danny Thomas spoke at the service and said "I will never ever forget his tremendous help to me, but I speak not just what he did for me, but what he has done for the entire industry."
Film at end is at Del Mar Racetrack on Jimmy Durante Day in 1958.

ABOUT WILL & GRACE
That's right, honey! A decade after their unforgettable eight-season run, comedy's most fabulous foursome is back. Debra Messing, Eric McCormack, Sean Hayes and Megan Mullally reprise their celebrated roles as Will, Grace, Jack and Karen. The 11th and final season of Will & Grace will feature 18 episodes. Behold once again, from the minds of Max Mutchnick and David Kohan, TV's wittiest ensemble ever. The legendary James Burrows, director of every original Will & Grace episode, has returned with a slew of razor-sharp jabs and dirty martinis. Will & Grace stands as NBC's most watched comedy in seven years. Originally debuting in 1998, Will & Grace has been nominated for 91 Emmy Awards, winning 18 of them, including Outstanding Comedy Series. The series has also earned seven SAG Awards and the show is one of the few in TV history where each member of the cast has won an Emmy.

title: Desi Arnazâ€™s Final Tribute to Lucille Ball Pt.1
description:
ðŸ‘‡We Have A Patreon!ðŸ‘‡
https://patreon.com/didyoucatchthis

A Final Love Letter: Desi Arnazâ€™s Tribute to Lucille Ball

In December 1986, the world lost a comedic legend, Desi Arnaz, just days before his ex-wife and longtime creative partner, Lucille Ball, was honored at the Kennedy Center Honors. Their love story, immortalized through their groundbreaking sitcom I Love Lucy, reached a poignant conclusion in the final days of Arnazâ€™s life.

The day before his passing, Arnaz and Ball shared an intimate phone call, where they exchanged heartfelt words. â€œI love you,â€ Ball repeated, with Arnaz responding tenderly, â€œI love you too, honey.â€ It was a fitting farewell for a couple whose lives had been intertwined in love and laughter.

Unbeknownst to Ball, a special message from Arnaz was prepared to be read at the Kennedy Center Honors just five days after his death. Delivered on his behalf, it celebrated not only Ballâ€™s comedic genius but also the profound impact of their shared work.

â€œI love Lucy had just one mission: to make people laugh,â€ Arnaz wrote. â€œLucy gave it a rare quality. She could perform the wildest, even the messiest physical comedy without losing her feminine appeal.â€ Reflecting on the showâ€™s success, Arnaz humbly credited Ball, saying, â€œGive Lucy 90% of the credit and divide the other 10% among the rest of us.â€

Desi concluded his tribute with a heartfelt declaration: â€œLucy was the show. Viv and Fred and I were just props. Damn good props, but props nevertheless. P.S. I Love Lucy was never just a title.â€

Arnazâ€™s words resonated as a testament to their love and partnership, a final love letter to the woman who was his muse, collaborator, and enduring friend. Even in his absence, Desi Arnazâ€™s admiration for Lucille Ball continues to echo, a reminder of their shared legacy in the hearts of fans worldwide.

title: I Love Lucy Apartment Tour [CG Tour]
description:
Take a tour of the I Love Lucy Apartment in color. This I Love Lucy Tour includes: Lucy and Ricky's kitchen, living room, bedroom, bathroom and even little Ricky's nursery. You'll get a fun tour of their apartment, but also documentary style information and facts about the I Love Lucy set design.  The show starred Desi Arnaz, Lucille Ball as Ricky and Lucy, and Vivian Vance and William Frawley as Fred and Ethel Mertz. 

With the recent Being the Ricardos movie and the upcoming Lucy and Desi documentary airing in March 2022, there is renewed interest in all things Desi and Lucy. This is like a documentary of the set - their apartment on the upper east side. We go over every detail, with experts along to give interesting facts, set bloopers and even props.

If you love classic tv and especially tv homes, if you love design - you'll love this channel. We'll explore their amazing New York City apartment, like you've never seen it before - with ceilings and all 4 walls, as if it were a real life apartment.

description:
Lucille Ball spoke with ET in 1984 about the success of â€˜I Love Lucyâ€™ and the hit sitcomâ€™s enduring popularity. Out of all the showâ€™s many iconic moments, the legendary actress revealed which episode was â€˜the most excitingâ€™ for her. She opened up about her marriage to Desi Arnaz and their eventual divorce in 1960. Ball also praised former co-stars Vivian Vance (famous for playing Ethel Mertz) and William Frowley (known to viewers as Fred Mertz), admitting that she can become emotional watching reruns that stir fond memories. â€˜I Love Lucyâ€™ is streaming on Paramount+.

description:

CLIP DESCRIPTION:
Owen (Cuba Gooding Jr.) tolerates a bus full of Lucille Ball impersonators and the distaster that ensues.

FILM DESCRIPTION:
A very loose remake of the classic multi-star comedy It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World (1963), this madcap comedy is directed by Jerry Zucker, one third of the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker comedy team and director of Ghost (1990). John Cleese stars as an eccentric casino owner who devises a contest pitting six teams against each other in a race to claim two million dollars from a locker in New Mexico. The competitors are Owen (Cuba Gooding Jr., who ends up driving a bus full of Lucille Ball imitators, a foreigner (Rowan Atkinson) who hitches a ride in an organ donor vehicle, and a recently reunited mother and daughter (Whoopi Goldberg and Lanei Chapman) who anger a "squirrel lady" (Kathy Bates) -- much to their regret. There are also two con artist brothers (Seth Green and Vince Vieluf), the upright Nick (Breckin Meyer), who gets a lift from cute but psychotic pilot Tracy (Amy Smart), and the eccentric Pear family, headed up by Jon Lovitz. Rat Race also stars Dave Thomas, Kathy Najimy, Wayne Knight, Dean Cain, and Paul Rodriguez.

title: This I Love Lucy Episode Was BANNED for 10 Years
description:
I Love Lucy is an American multinational television sitcom that originally ran on CBS from October 15, 1951 to May 6, 1957, with a total of 180 half-hour episodes spanning six seasons. The show, which was the first scripted television program to be shot on 35mm film in front of a studio audience, by cinematographer Karl Freund, won five Emmy Awards and received numerous nominations and honors. It was the first show ever to feature an ensemble cast. It is often regarded as one of the greatest and most influential sitcoms in history. In 2012, it was voted the 'Best TV Show of All Time' in a survey conducted by ABC News and People magazine. 
 
Even though it was immensely popular, I Love Lucy still encountered controversy when one of its episodes had to be pulled from syndication. The episode was called "The Ricardos Visit Cuba". This episode was a fun and innocent trip for the Ricardo family, who traveled to Cuba to visit family. Due to political tensions at the time, networks and even some of the show's producers were concerned that the episode would be too controversial. As a result, it was taken off the air immediately following its first run. The rest of I Love Lucy continued without any issues, and ten years later, this controversial episode would return to televisions.

Make sure you watch the whole video, as we also take a look at one of the other controversial moments in I Love Lucy history - Lucy's pregnancy. Lucy was the first pregnant woman to be shown on television, a decision that would solidify the show's place in history while shaping the future of television. In this video, we'll look at how this decision came to be, and how it was handled by the cast, producers and audiences.

title: How Each I Love Lucy Cast Member Died
description:
I Love Lucy was one of the most significant, culturally defining, and hilarious sitcoms of the mid-20th Century. Everybody loved the show's female lead, Lucille Ball, and her on and off-screen husband Desi Arnaz.

Like this content? Subscribe here: https://www.youtube.com/factsverse?sub_confirmation=1

Click below to check the trivia question
 

It was the first series to be rerun on TV in syndication after going off the air in 1957. It was also the first series to create numerous spin-off shows like The Lucy-Desi Comedy Hour, The Lucy Show, Here's Lucy, and Life With Lucy. I Love Lucy to this day can still be seen in 80 countries worldwide in 22 languages.

But even though I Love Lucy continues to be a popular comedy series in syndication, the vast majority of the show's cast members are no longer alive to enjoy the fame and praise that they deserve. In this video, we'll reveal how each cast member of I Love Lucy died. While it's sad that so many actors are no longer with us, it's nice to honor their life and careers by remembering their many contributions. In the comments section, don't forget to let us know why your favorite I Love Lucy cast member was. And don't forget to show us a little love by giving this video a like and by subscribing to this channel. That way you'll be able to keep up with all of our latest and upcoming videos.

title: I Love Lucy Country Home Tour [CG Tour]
description:
Take a tour of the I Love Lucy Country Home in color. This I Love Lucy Tour includes: the living room, dining room, kitchen, den, bedroom and Fred and Ethel's Guest Cottage House. PLUS, an interview with Keith Thibodeaux, who played Little Ricky. He recalls memories from the set and behind the scenes stories. The show also starred Desi Arnaz as Ricky Ricardo, Lucille Ball as Lucy Ricardo with Vivian Vance and William Frawley as Fred and Ethel Mertz.

If you love classic tv and especially tv homes, if you love design - you'll love this channel. We'll explore every inch of this amazing country farm house, adding ceilings and all 4 walls as we take the tour so that it feels like a real life home.

title: Lucy's Big Surprise - Hilarious Pregnancy Announcement | I Love Lucy Classics
description:
When Lucy learns that she's going to have a baby, she tries to find the right way to tell this to Ricky.

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. All 180 episodes aired on Mondays.

In total 180 episodes of I Love Lucy were produced, plus a pilot episode. The pilot, which was not made for broadcast and did not air as part of the show's original run, is generally not counted as one of the episodes and therefore listed separately for reference. It is, however, available on DVD and Blu-ray releases of the first season. Following I Love Lucy, a further 13 one hour-long episodes were produced under the title of The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show (later and more commonly known in syndication as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour) with the same cast and later packaged as seasons 7, 8 & 9 under the I Love Lucy series.

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. All 180 episodes aired on Mondays.

In total 180 episodes of I Love Lucy were produced, plus a pilot episode. The pilot, which was not made for broadcast and did not air as part of the show's original run, is generally not counted as one of the episodes and therefore listed separately for reference. It is, however, available on DVD and Blu-ray releases of the first season. Following I Love Lucy, a further 13 one hour-long episodes were produced under the title of The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show (later and more commonly known in syndication as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour) with the same cast and later packaged as seasons 7, 8 & 9 under the I Love Lucy series.

title: Classic Comedy Gold I Love Lucy  - Tennessee Bound
description:
Welcome to this retrospective look at "I Love Lucy" season 4, episode 15, titled "Tennessee Bound". This classic episode from the iconic television series aired on January 26, 1955, and remains one of the most beloved and memorable episodes of the show.

The episode begins with Lucy, Ricky, Fred, and Ethel on their way to Hollywood in their trusty trailer. However, they find themselves stranded in a small town in Tennessee when their car breaks down. With no money to fix the car, they come up with the idea of putting on a show to raise the funds they need to continue their journey.

Lucy and Ethel decide to put on a hillbilly act, and they set out to find the right costumes and props. However, their search proves more difficult than they anticipated, and they end up causing chaos in a local store while trying on outfits.

Meanwhile, Ricky and Fred try to recruit some local talent for the show. They find a group of enthusiastic volunteers, but their lack of experience makes it clear that this won't be an easy performance.

As the big night approaches, Lucy and Ethel struggle with their hillbilly accents, and things seem to be falling apart. However, their performance ends up being a hit, and the audience loves it. They raise enough money to fix the car and continue on their journey to Hollywood.

Throughout the episode, Lucille Ball's comedic talents are on full display as she delivers her trademark physical humor and impeccable timing. The chemistry between the cast is evident as they work together to create a hilarious and heartwarming episode.

In conclusion, "Tennessee Bound" is a classic episode of "I Love Lucy" that continues to be beloved by fans of the show and lovers of classic television. Its timeless humor and heartwarming moments are a testament to the enduring appeal of Lucille Ball and the talented cast of "I Love Lucy".

ABOUT WILL & GRACE
That's right, honey! A decade after their unforgettable eight-season run, comedy's most fabulous foursome is back. Debra Messing, Eric McCormack, Sean Hayes and Megan Mullally reprise their celebrated roles as Will, Grace, Jack and Karen. The 11th and final season of Will & Grace will feature 18 episodes. Behold once again, from the minds of Max Mutchnick and David Kohan, TV's wittiest ensemble ever. The legendary James Burrows, director of every original Will & Grace episode, has returned with a slew of razor-sharp jabs and dirty martinis. Will & Grace stands as NBC's most watched comedy in seven years. Originally debuting in 1998, Will & Grace has been nominated for 91 Emmy Awards, winning 18 of them, including Outstanding Comedy Series. The series has also earned seven SAG Awards and the show is one of the few in TV history where each member of the cast has won an Emmy.

title: I Love Lucy: Tallulah Bankhead LOST HIVES SCENE
description:
Tallulah Bankhead explains to Lucy Ricardo that she's allergic to strawberries in this lost scene from "The Celebrity Next Door."

This scene was missing from the 1997 VHS video release of the episode, and is missing from the DVD set of the "Lucy-Desi Comedy Hour," Seasons 7-9.  It is not found on the special features portion of the disc, nor was it shown on TVLand reruns.

Without this scene, key plot twists later in the episode that refer to Bankhead's strawberry allergy make no sense at all to the viewer.

As aired on CBS on December 3, 1957.

title: 'Absolutely...Demonic': 'I Love Lucy Star' Descends Into Occult Before Finding God
description:
Keith Thibodeaux had it all. He played "Little Ricky" on iconic TV show, "I Love Lucy" and spent his childhood with Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz and their family. But something happened as he grew up. Pain, uncertainty, and frustration led him on a dangerous path into the occult. At one point, Thibodeaux was tormented by demonic voices and wanted to end it all.

Then, Jesus stepped in. Here is Thibodeaux's powerful story.

title: I Love Lucy | Lucy convinces Ethel that both of their marriages are in a rut
description:
Lucy convinces Ethel that both of their marriages are in a rut. They decide to take some time away from their spouses. Lucy moves in with Ethel and Fred moves in with Ricky. By Saturday night they all get bored and both attempt to check the activity of the other pair at the same time. Lucy and Ethel almost get caught spying and end up getting locked on the roof in their night clothes.

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. All 180 episodes aired on Mondays.

In total 180 episodes of I Love Lucy were produced, plus a pilot episode. The pilot, which was not made for broadcast and did not air as part of the show's original run, is generally not counted as one of the episodes and therefore listed separately for reference. It is, however, available on DVD and Blu-ray releases of the first season. Following I Love Lucy, a further 13 one hour-long episodes were produced under the title of The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show (later and more commonly known in syndication as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour) with the same cast and later packaged as seasons 7, 8 & 9 under the I Love Lucy series.

title: I Love Lucy 1951 - 1957 Opening and Closing Theme (With Snippets)
description:
Loads more TV Themes at: http://teeveesgreatest.webs.com/

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. After the series ended in 1957, however, a modified version continued for three more seasons with 13 one-hour specials, running from 1957 to 1960, known first as The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show and later in reruns as The Lucy - Desi Comedy Hour.

The show, which was the first scripted television program to be shot on 35 mm film in front of a studio audience, won five Emmy Awards and received numerous nominations. Another award that the show won was the coveted Peabody Award for "recognition of distinguished achievement in television." I Love Lucy was the most watched show in the United States in four of its six seasons, and was the first to end its run at the top of the Nielsen ratings (an accomplishment later matched only by The Andy Griffith Show in 1968 and Seinfeld in 1998 .

The show is still syndicated in dozens of languages across the world, and remains popular, with an American audience of 40 million each year. A colorized version of its Christmas episode attracted more than eight million viewers when CBS aired it in prime time in 2013 - 62 years after the show premiered.

A second colorized special, featuring the "L.A. At Last!" and "Lucy and Superman" episodes, aired on May 17, 2015, attracting 6.4 million viewers. I Love Lucy is often regarded as one of the greatest and most influential sitcoms in history. In 2012, it was voted the 'Best TV Show of All Time' in a survey conducted by ABC News and People Magazine.

title: I Love Lucy: Hollywood Suite Tour [CG Tour]
description:
Take a tour of the I Love Lucy set from their Hollywood Suite in Los Angeles in color. This I Love Lucy Tour includes: their hotel living room, kitchen and bedroom.  You'll get a fun tour of their hotel room, but also fun facts and information along the way. The show starred Desi Arnaz, Lucille Ball and Ricky and Lucy, and Vivian Vance and William Frawley as Fred and Ethel Mertz.
If you love classic tv and especially classic tv homes and if you love set design - you'll love this channel. We'll explore their amazing mid century modern hotel suite like you've never seen it before - with ceilings and all 4 walls, as if it were a real life home.

title: Hilarious Hijinks Unleashed! | I Love Lucy - Lucy's Fake Illness Fiasco
description:
Step into the golden age of television and join us as we dive into the hilarious world of "I Love Lucy"! In this unforgettable episode, S01E16, titled "Lucy Fakes Illness," we witness the comedic genius of Lucille Ball in full swing.

In this side-splitting adventure, Lucy Ricardo, our beloved redhead protagonist, finds herself caught in a mischievous web of deception. Determined to escape a tedious afternoon at home, Lucy concocts a brilliant plan to create chaos and excitement. With her indomitable spirit and unyielding desire for adventure, Lucy hatches a scheme that will keep everyone on their toes!

As the episode unfolds, Lucy's cunning plot centers around feigning illness. In a desperate attempt to avoid household chores and revel in some much-needed excitement, she executes her deceptive plan with flawless comedic timing. With the support of her hilarious sidekick and husband, Ricky Ricardo, played by the charismatic Desi Arnaz, the stage is set for a rollercoaster ride of laughter and mayhem.

Lucy's fabricated illness sparks a frenzy of concern among her friends and neighbors, leading to a series of comical mishaps and misunderstandings. As the chaos escalates, her best friend and partner-in-crime, Ethel Mertz, portrayed brilliantly by Vivian Vance, gets unwittingly involved in Lucy's scheme, setting the stage for uproarious moments of physical comedy and witty banter.

Amidst the pandemonium, Ricky's skepticism begins to waver, and he becomes entangled in Lucy's web of deception. The dynamics between the couple reach new heights of hilarity as they navigate the consequences of Lucy's ruse, showcasing the iconic chemistry that made them one of television's most beloved couples.

With its sharp writing, impeccable comedic timing, and stellar performances, "Lucy Fakes Illness" exemplifies the timeless charm of "I Love Lucy." This episode captures the essence of the show's enduring popularity, delivering belly laughs and heartwarming moments that have endeared it to audiences for generations.

So, join us as we relive this classic television gem, filled with unforgettable comedic moments and a healthy dose of Lucy's zany escapades. Experience the magic that continues to captivate audiences worldwide and discover why "I Love Lucy" remains a timeless treasure of television history!

Don't forget to like, subscribe, and hit the notification bell to stay tuned for more nostalgic episodes and behind-the-scenes insights from the golden era of television. Relive the laughter, relish the memories, and celebrate the comedic brilliance of "I Love Lucy"!

#ILoveLucy #TVsitcom #ClassicTV

title: Desi Arnazâ€™s Tribute to Lucille Ball Pt.2
description:
ðŸ‘‡We Have A Patreon!ðŸ‘‡
https://patreon.com/didyoucatchthis

A Final Love Letter: Desi Arnazâ€™s Tribute to Lucille Ball

In December 1986, the world lost a comedic legend, Desi Arnaz, just days before his ex-wife and longtime creative partner, Lucille Ball, was honored at the Kennedy Center Honors. Their love story, immortalized through their groundbreaking sitcom I Love Lucy, reached a poignant conclusion in the final days of Arnazâ€™s life.

The day before his passing, Arnaz and Ball shared an intimate phone call, where they exchanged heartfelt words. â€œI love you,â€ Ball repeated, with Arnaz responding tenderly, â€œI love you too, honey.â€ It was a fitting farewell for a couple whose lives had been intertwined in love and laughter.

Unbeknownst to Ball, a special message from Arnaz was prepared to be read at the Kennedy Center Honors just five days after his death. Delivered on his behalf, it celebrated not only Ballâ€™s comedic genius but also the profound impact of their shared work.

â€œI love Lucy had just one mission: to make people laugh,â€ Arnaz wrote. â€œLucy gave it a rare quality. She could perform the wildest, even the messiest physical comedy without losing her feminine appeal.â€ Reflecting on the showâ€™s success, Arnaz humbly credited Ball, saying, â€œGive Lucy 90% of the credit and divide the other 10% among the rest of us.â€

Desi concluded his tribute with a heartfelt declaration: â€œLucy was the show. Viv and Fred and I were just props. Damn good props, but props nevertheless. P.S. I Love Lucy was never just a title.â€

Arnazâ€™s words resonated as a testament to their love and partnership, a final love letter to the woman who was his muse, collaborator, and enduring friend. Even in his absence, Desi Arnazâ€™s admiration for Lucille Ball continues to echo, a reminder of their shared legacy in the hearts of fans worldwide.

title: Vivian Vance Spills the Secret She Kept During I Love Lucy
description:
Vivian Vance, a talented and versatile actress, is best known for her portrayal of Ethel Mertz on the iconic sitcom "I Love Lucy." Throughout her career, Vance faced various challenges, particularly during her time on the show, but she overcame them with resilience and left a lasting legacy in the world of entertainment. One significant challenge Vance encountered on "I Love Lucy" was the initial strain in her relationship with Lucille Ball. Vance had reservations about accepting the role of Ethel Mertz, feeling concerned that it might limit her career opportunities. However, Ball, recognizing Vance's comedic talent, convinced her to take on the role. Over time, Vance embraced the character and showcased her comedic timing and chemistry with Ball, making the Lucy-Ethel dynamic an integral part of the show's success.

Vance also faced challenges in her relationship with William Frawley, who played her on-screen husband, Fred Mertz. Despite their on-screen chemistry, Vance and Frawley had a complex relationship off-screen. Frawley, considerably older than Vance, had initial reservations about playing her husband due to the age difference. Additionally, Frawley's sometimes unpredictable behavior caused occasional tensions between the two. However, they set aside their personal conflicts during filming and delivered convincing performances as the endearing couple Fred and Ethel Mertz. Beyond the challenges, Vance's talent and comedic skills on "I Love Lucy" left an indelible mark. 

Her portrayal of Ethel Mertz, a loyal and supportive friend to Lucy Ricardo, showcased her impeccable comedic timing, deadpan delivery, and ability to hold her own alongside the comedic genius of Lucille Ball. Vance's performance added depth and humor to the show, creating a beloved dynamic duo that remains iconic to this day. Vivian Vance's legacy as an actress extends far beyond her work on "I Love Lucy." Her talent and versatility were evident in her other roles, both on stage and screen. She demonstrated her range in theater productions and made notable appearances on various television shows. Vance's ability to captivate audiences with her comedic prowess, combined with her dramatic skills, solidifies her status as a versatile and accomplished actress. Join Facts Verse, as we present: Vivian Vance Spills the Secret She Kept During I Love Lucy!

title: I Love Lucy | Destination: California! | Lucy & Ricky's Hilarious Road Trip Antics
description:
Join us as we journey back to the golden age of television with one of the most iconic episodes of "I Love Lucy"! In Season 4 Episode 12, titled "California, Here We Come!", the Ricardos and the Mertzes hit the road for an unforgettable cross-country adventure from New York to California.

In this hilarious and heartwarming episode, Lucy, Ricky, Ethel, and Fred encounter a series of uproarious mishaps and comedic escapades as they travel across the country in their trusty car. From getting lost in the wilderness to encountering eccentric characters along the way, every moment is packed with laughter and classic Lucy charm.

Join us as we revisit this timeless episode and relive the unforgettable moments that have solidified "I Love Lucy" as one of the greatest sitcoms of all time. Don't miss out on the fun â€“ hit play and embark on this delightful journey with Lucy and the gang!

title: Desi Arnaz Refused to Film This I Love Lucy Scene
description:
Desi Arnaz was an entertainer that came to America from Cuba at a young age and found success on television alongside his partner Lucille Ball. Together, the two starred in the hit show I Love Lucy, which ran for six seasons throughout the 1950s. The two each gave their all to their respective comedic performances on the show. However, there was one particular line that Desi refused to cross over the course of the showâ€™s run due to strong personal beliefs.

Like this content? Subscribe here: https://www.youtube.com/factsverse?sub_confirmation=1  

Or, watch more videos here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLkXAntdjbcSKgHx6EQVOwNKVz1cR2hKVw

Desi was born in the early 20th century, and his father was the mayor of the second-largest city in Cuba. While this gave young Desi a life of relative ease during his early years, the 1933 Cuban Revolution put an abrupt end to that luxury during the young starâ€™s teenage years. The revolution found his father imprisoned by revolutionaries. Desiâ€™s family was able to free his father, but they were then forced to flee to America. Knowing none of the wealth that they were accustomed to in Cuba, the family was forced to work their way up. They made a living cleaning canary cages and doing other small jobs, allowing Desi to eventually work his way up to becoming the successful performer he became known as.

While these struggles could have made the young Desi grown into a bitter adult, they instead instilled a sense of wonder in the man about the possibilities provided by America to immigrant families such as his. Desi soon became a gigantic patriot and a vocal supporter of the American dream, always maintaining a strong work ethic.

Desi also had other values instilled in him at childhood, and some of these werenâ€™t as positive as his beliefs in hard work and the American dream. He adamantly believed that a woman should be subservient to a man in a marriage, and this hurt his personal relationship with his costar and wife Lucille Ball. Lucille has recalled instances during their marriage where Desiâ€™s personal beliefs got in the way of her happiness, eventually causing the marriage to dissolve. Whether right or wrong, Desi always adamantly stood for his own personal beliefs. Join Facts Verse as we explore why Desi Arnaz refused to film this I Love Lucy scene.

Desi Arnaz Refused to Film This I Love Lucy Scene

title: I Love Lucy | Lucy's Love Letter Lunacy! | Lucy Changes Her Mind
description:
ðŸ“º Dive into the hilarious world of "I Love Lucy" with this recap of Season 2 Episode 21 â€“ "Lucy Changes Her Mind." In this classic episode, Ricky becomes fed up with Lucy's indecisiveness and challenges her to finish everything she starts. The results are nothing short of comedic brilliance!

ðŸ’Œ Watch as Lucy stumbles upon an old, incomplete love letter to a former flame and decides to take Ricky's challenge to heart. Join us as Lucy navigates the awkward and often uproarious journey of completing the unfinished letter, leading to a cascade of side-splitting misadventures.

title: The Scene That Took I Love Lucy off the Air
description:
Which Lucille Ball television show are you the biggest fan of? Did you think that The Desi-Lucy Comedy Hour did a good job capturing the magic that I Love Lucy so effortlessly delivered? Let us know in the comments section down below.

https://bit.ly/3rEeMxk  

I Love Lucy was trailblazing series that introduced the world to the talents of Lucille Ball and her then-husband Desi Arnaz. While the series would get its start when Ball and Arnaz were still married, by the end of its run, cracks would form in their relationship that would eventually lead to its end.

After being on the air for six seasons and 180 half-hour episodes, the highly-influential and beloved American sitcom I Love Lucy wrapped up with somewhat of an anticlimactic series finale on May 6, 1957. The stars of I Love Lucy, Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, William Frawley, and Vivian Vance had developed quite a following of devoted fans in the time that the show they helped create was on the airwaves. And when it was time for us all to bid them farewell, it was a very bittersweet moment indeed.

Join Facts verse as we take a look at the final episode of the pioneering series. We'll discuss the several I Love Lucy spin-off shows that filled some of that hole that was left in the hearts of fans after the series went off the air. And if you're curious about whether or not Lucille Ball's and Desi Arnez's divorce played any kind of role in the show's run time, we'll be covering that as well.

The Scene That Took I Love Lucy off the Air

title: I Love Lucy | Lost in Translation | Lucy's French Fiasco!
description:
In this classic episode of "I Love Lucy," titled "The French Revue," Lucy Ricardo finds herself in a hilarious predicament after a humiliating experience at a restaurant. Determined to redeem herself, Lucy embarks on a comedic journey of French language lessons and cultural immersion.

As Lucy strives to impress her husband Ricky, who is producing a new French-themed revue, viewers are treated to uproarious scenes of Lucy's attempts to master the French language and integrate herself into the show. From comical mispronunciations to uproarious misunderstandings, Lucy's escapades keep audiences laughing throughout.

Join us as we delve into the highlights of Season 3, Episode 7, exploring Lucy's relentless pursuit of acceptance into Ricky's production. Through witty dialogue and timeless humor, "The French Revue" captures the essence of the beloved sitcom's charm and enduring appeal.

Discover the laughter and charm of "I Love Lucy" as we dissect the memorable moments and comedic genius of this beloved episode. Don't miss out on revisiting one of television's most iconic series, where Lucy's antics never fail to entertain and delight audiences of all ages!

#ILoveLucy #ClassicTV #ComedyGold #LucilleBall

title: I Love Lucy | Lucy competes with her friend Carolyn Appleby
description:
Lucy competes with her friend Carolyn Appleby over invitations and scheduling for Little Ricky's birthday party. When her husband Ricky mentions that Superman is in town, Lucy tries to get Superman to come to Little Ricky's party, sure that this will make it a much bigger draw than the one Carolyn is hosting. Ricky tries, but Superman can't make the party. So Lucy disguises herself as Superman, but gets herself into great peril. Fortunately, the real Superman does show up to save the day.

title: Desi Arnaz - I Love Lucy (Columbia Records 1953)
description:
"I Love Lucy" is the title song to the television sitcom.  The music was written as an instrumental with lyrics written by Harold Adamson, who was nominated five times for an Oscar. The lyrics to "I Love Lucy" were sung by Desi Arnaz in the episode "Lucy's Last Birthday".

I Love Lucy is a landmark American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. After the series ended in 1957, however, a modified version continued for three more seasons with 13 one-hour specials, running from 1957 to 1960, known first as The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show and later in reruns as The Lucy--Desi Comedy Hour.

I Love Lucy was the most watched show in the United States in four of its six seasons, and was the first to end its run at the top of the Nielsen ratings (an accomplishment later matched by The Andy Griffith Show and Seinfeld). I Love Lucy is still syndicated in dozens of languages across the world. A colorized version of its Christmas episode attracted more than 8 million viewers when CBS aired it in prime time in 2013 -- 62 years after the show premiered.

The show was the first scripted television program to be shot on 35 mm film in front of a studio audience, and won five Emmy Awards and received numerous nominations. Another award that the show won was the coveted George Foster Peabody Award for "recognition of distinguished achievement in television." In 2002, it ranked second on TV Guide's list of television's greatest shows, behind Seinfeld and ahead of The Honeymooners. In 2007, it was listed as one of Time magazine's "100 Best TV Shows of All-TIME." I Love Lucy remains popular, with an American audience of 40 million each year.

title: Hilarious Hijinks and Fan Frenzy! | I Love Lucy: The Young Fans
description:
Welcome to another exciting episode of "I Love Lucy," where laughter and heartwarming moments collide! In this classic installment, titled "The Young Fans," Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz bring their iconic characters, Lucy and Ricky Ricardo, to life once again, delivering a delightful blend of comedy and charm.

In this unforgettable episode, Lucy and Ricky find themselves caught in a whirlwind of unexpected events when a group of young fans unexpectedly descends upon their home. As devoted admirers of Ricky's band, these enthusiastic youngsters can't contain their excitement at the thought of meeting their favorite musical idol and his beloved wife.

What follows is a riotous series of misadventures as Lucy, always eager to please, tries to accommodate the young fans' every desire. From orchestrating an impromptu concert in their living room to attempting to teach the kids some dance moves, Lucy's well-intentioned plans quickly spiral out of control, leaving Ricky to bear the brunt of the chaos.

Meanwhile, Ethel and Fred Mertz, the Ricardo's trusted and hilarious neighbors, are inadvertently roped into the madness. With their sharp wit and impeccable comedic timing, Ethel and Fred find themselves embroiled in Lucy's schemes, adding an extra layer of hilarity to the already uproarious situation.

Amidst the laughter and commotion, "The Young Fans" episode also offers moments of genuine emotion and heartwarming interactions. As Lucy and Ricky interact with the young admirers, they showcase their genuine love for their fans and each other, highlighting the endearing nature of their relationship.

With Lucille Ball's unparalleled comedic genius, Desi Arnaz's irresistible charm, and the brilliant chemistry between the entire cast, "I Love Lucy: The Young Fans" delivers a perfect blend of side-splitting comedy and heartwarming moments that have made the show an enduring classic.

Join us as we revisit this memorable episode, reliving the laughter, chaos, and the genuine love that made "I Love Lucy" a timeless favorite for generations. So grab your popcorn, settle in, and get ready to laugh your heart out with Lucy, Ricky, Ethel, and Fred in this hilarious and heartwarming journey!

Don't forget to like, share, and subscribe to our channel for more nostalgic trips down TV memory lane. Let's celebrate the brilliance of "I Love Lucy" together!

#ILoveLucy #TVsitcom #ClassicTV

title: I Love Lucy Best Moments Part 1: Now in Color!
description:
Note about Colorization: This video is colorized by me, not CBS. When CBS colorizes something, they take the time to go frame by frame. This video is colorized by artificial intelligence, and although it's gotten very good at pictures, it still has some ways to go with video. Because of this, I feel the colors look muted and very warm. In the future, I will continue to upload my I Love Lucy In Color Series (which is colorized by CBS and looks perfect) and will also upload my black and white best moment series (as there are way more episodes that are only in black and white then those colorized). When I upload a black and white video, I will upload a colorized version as well, it won't look amazing but think of it like a bonus.

This is the first video in my series I Love Lucy Best Moments: Part 1, now newly colorized by me! Below is a little guide because I know these titles can start to get confusing:
I Love Lucy Best Moments; Best moments from I Love Lucy in black and white

I Love Lucy Best Moments in Color!; Best moments from I Love Lucy in color

I Love Lucy Best Moments: Now in Color!; Best moments videos originally in black and white colorized

Thank you all!

title: I LOVE LUCY (1951) Cast THEN AND NOW 2023, All cast died tragically!
description:
I LOVE LUCY (1951) Cast THEN AND NOW 2023, All cast died tragically!
I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom that originally aired on CBS from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, with a total of 180 half-hour episodes, spanning six seasons. The show starred Lucille Ball, her husband, Desi Arnaz, along with Vivian Vance and William Frawley. The series followed the life of Lucy Ricardo (Ball), a young, middle-class housewife living in New York City, who often concocted plans with her best friends and landlords, Ethel and Fred Mertz (Vance and Frawley), to appear alongside her bandleader husband, Ricky Ricardo (Arnaz), in his nightclub. Lucy is depicted trying numerous schemes to mingle with and be a part of show business. After the series ended in 1957, a modified version of the show continued for three more seasons, with 13 one-hour specials, which ran from 1957 to 1960. It was first known as The Lucille Ballâ€“Desi Arnaz Show, and later, in reruns, as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour.

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. All 180 episodes aired on Mondays.

In total 180 episodes of I Love Lucy were produced, plus a pilot episode. The pilot, which was not made for broadcast and did not air as part of the show's original run, is generally not counted as one of the episodes and therefore listed separately for reference. It is, however, available on DVD and Blu-ray releases of the first season. Following I Love Lucy, a further 13 one hour-long episodes were produced under the title of The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show (later and more commonly known in syndication as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour) with the same cast and later packaged as seasons 7, 8 & 9 under the I Love Lucy series.

title: Seeing Double Trouble | Lucy's Eye Exam Hilarity! | I Love Lucy
description:
In this classic episode of "I Love Lucy," titled "Lucy Has Her Eyes Examined" from Season 3, Lucy Ricardo finds herself in a whirlwind of comedic mishaps. Set against the backdrop of Ricky's show, Lucy scores a coveted dancing role but soon faces an unexpected obstacle: an eye examination.

As Lucy visits the optometrist for a routine check-up, things take a hilarious turn when she receives eye drops that render her nearly blind! Watch as Lucy navigates a series of uproarious misunderstandings and calamities, all while attempting to maintain her composure amidst the chaos.

Join Lucy, Ricky, Ethel, and Fred in this unforgettable episode filled with side-splitting laughter and unforgettable moments. From Lucy's slapstick antics to Ricky's exasperated reactions, "Lucy Has Her Eyes Examined" promises non-stop entertainment for fans of classic television comedy.

Tune in to witness the timeless humor and endearing charm of "I Love Lucy" as Lucy Ricardo proves once again that even the simplest tasks can spiral into uproarious adventures! Don't miss out on this iconic episode that has delighted audiences for generations. Hit play and prepare to laugh until your sides hurt!

#ILoveLucy #ClassicTV #ComedyGold #LucilleBall

title: The Real Life Love Story Behind â€˜I Love Lucyâ€™
description: â€œI Love Lucy,â€ one of the most beloved sitcoms in television history, was based on the real-life love story of Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz. A new documentary, â€œLucy and Desi,â€ sheds light on that romance, and also the end of the love story. Lucy and Desiâ€™s two children participate in the documentary, as do legendary comedians Carol Burnett and Bette Midler. They became a Hollywood power couple, and their studio, Desi-Lu, produced some of the biggest hits of the 1960s.

title: National Comedy Center celebrates "I Love Lucy" 70th anniversary
description:
Friday marks 70 years since "I Love Lucy" made its debut on CBS. It was a major hit at the time and went on to a life in syndication and streaming that continues to this day. The show had a big impact on television and also on a small town in upstate New York. Jamie Wax has more.

â€œCBS Saturday Morningâ€ co-hosts Jeff Glor, Michelle Miller and Dana Jacobson deliver two hours of original reporting and breaking news, as well as profiles of leading figures in culture and the arts.

title: Desi Arnaz death: Original 1986 obituary on 'I Love Lucy' star's lung-cancer death
description:
This report on the death of Desi Arnaz, who had lung cancer, aired on Dec. 2, 1986, the day of his death. Lucie Arnaz, his daughter, says her father died in her arms, and urged people not to smoke. She says her dad was the "I" in "I Love Lucy."

title: I Love Lucy Best Moments Part 2: Now in Color!
description:
Note about Colorization: This video is colorized by me, not CBS. When CBS colorizes something, they take the time to go frame by frame. This video is colorized by artificial intelligence, and although it's gotten very good at pictures, it still has some ways to go with video. Because of this, I feel the colors look muted and very warm. In the future, I will continue to upload my I Love Lucy In Color Series (which is colorized by CBS and looks perfect) and will also upload my black and white best moment series (as there are way more episodes that are only in black and white then those colorized). When I upload a black and white video, I will upload a colorized version as well, it won't look amazing but think of it like a bonus.

This is the second video in my series, I Love Lucy Best Moments: Part 2, now newly colorized by me! Below is a little guide because I know these titles can start to get confusing:
I Love Lucy Best Moments; Best moments from I Love Lucy in black and white

I Love Lucy Best Moments in Color!; Best moments from I Love Lucy in color

I Love Lucy Best Moments: Now in Color!; Best moments videos originally in black and white colorized

Thank you all!

title: I Love Lucy | Lucy's Unforgettable Oops-Day! ðŸ˜‚ðŸŽ‰ | Lucy's Last Birthday Comedy Special
description:
ðŸŽ‰ Join us for a trip down memory lane with the classic sitcom "I Love Lucy" in Season 2, Episode 25 - "Lucy's Last Birthday"! In this timeless gem, Lucy finds herself in a hilarious predicament when she mistakenly believes everyone has forgotten her birthday. The result? A rollercoaster of emotions, side-splitting moments, and an unforgettable surprise party that takes an unexpected turn!

ðŸ˜¢ Watch as Lucy, played by the incomparable Lucille Ball, navigates through her feelings of sadness and abandonment, unknowingly wandering off while her friends and family anxiously await her at the club for a celebration she'll never forget. With Ricky, Ethel, and Fred in on the elaborate plan, the stage is set for a comedic masterpiece that showcases the brilliant comedic timing and chemistry of the iconic cast.

ðŸŽ‚ Will Lucy's birthday end in tears, or will the surprise party turn the tables and leave us all in stitches? Find out in this classic episode that captures the essence of "I Love Lucy" and its timeless appeal. Don't miss the laughter, the antics, and the heartwarming moments that make this episode a fan favorite.

ðŸŒŸ Whether you're a longtime fan or discovering the magic of "I Love Lucy" for the first time, join us as we delve into the unforgettable moments of Season 2, Episode 25 - "Lucy's Last Birthday." title: I Love Lucy | Countdown to Hollywood | The Ricardos & Mertzes Prepare for Movie Magic!
description:
Join Lucy, Ricky, Ethel, and Fred in the uproarious Season 4, Episode 10 of "I Love Lucy" titled "Getting Ready"! In this classic episode from 1955, the Ricardos and the Mertzes gear up for their big move to California, where Ricky has landed a role in a Hollywood movie.

Watch as Lucy's excitement reaches new heights as she imagines herself as a glamorous star in Tinseltown. However, chaos ensues as the gang attempts to pack and prepare for their cross-country journey, with Lucy and Ethel's hilarious antics taking center stage.

From wardrobe malfunctions to last-minute mishaps, the laughter never stops as the beloved characters navigate the challenges of getting ready for their Hollywood adventure. Will they make it to California in one piece, or will Lucy's schemes lead them astray?

Tune in to this timeless episode filled with side-splitting comedy and classic moments from one of television's most iconic sitcoms, "I Love Lucy"! Don't miss out on the fun as the Ricardos and the Mertzes embark on their unforgettable trip to the land of stars and dreams. Subscribe and hit the notification bell to stay updated on more classic TV highlights!

#ILoveLucy #ClassicTV #ComedyGold #LucyAndEthel #TVHistory

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. All 180 episodes aired on Mondays.

In total 180 episodes of I Love Lucy were produced, plus a pilot episode. The pilot, which was not made for broadcast and did not air as part of the show's original run, is generally not counted as one of the episodes and therefore listed separately for reference. It is, however, available on DVD and Blu-ray releases of the first season. Following I Love Lucy, a further 13 one hour-long episodes were produced under the title of The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show (later and more commonly known in syndication as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour) with the same cast and later packaged as seasons 7, 8 & 9 under the I Love Lucy series.

title: I Love Lucy | Truth or Consequences | Lucy's Honest Day!
description:
In this classic episode of "I Love Lucy," titled "Lucy Tells the Truth," Lucy Ricardo finds herself in a hilarious predicament when her husband Ricky and their friends, the Mertzes, challenge her to go an entire day without telling a single lie. What starts as a simple wager quickly spirals into chaos as Lucy's unfiltered honesty sends shockwaves through their tight-knit group.

As Lucy attempts to navigate her day with complete truthfulness, Ricky and the Mertzes soon realize that honesty isn't always the best policy, especially when it comes to sparing feelings and avoiding uncomfortable situations. From awkward encounters to laugh-out-loud misunderstandings, this episode is a rollercoaster of comedic moments that showcase Lucille Ball's impeccable comedic timing and the undeniable chemistry between the show's beloved characters.

Join us as we dive into the hilarity and charm of "I Love Lucy: Lucy Tells the Truth," a timeless episode that continues to entertain audiences with its wit and warmth decades after it first aired. Sit back, relax, and get ready to laugh along with Lucy and the gang in this unforgettable television classic!

#ILoveLucy #ClassicTV #ComedyGold #LucilleBall

title: Lights, Camera, Lucy | The Riotous Ricky Movie Fiasco! | I Love Lucy
description:
Join us for a laughter-packed recap of one of the most memorable episodes from "I Love Lucy" Season 4! In Episode 5, titled "Ricky's Movie Offer," Lucy finds herself unwittingly wreaking havoc as she tries to help Ricky secure a movie role. When a talent scout comes knocking, Lucy's zany antics turn a simple opportunity into a sidesplitting comedy of errors.

Watch as Lucy's well-meaning intentions spiral out of control, leading to uproarious misunderstandings and uproariously funny moments that have become iconic in television history. From mistaken identities to outrageous mishaps, this episode showcases Lucille Ball's comedic genius at its finest.

Tune in for a trip down memory lane as we revisit the timeless humor and charm of "I Love Lucy." Don't miss out on the laughter and joy that this classic sitcom continues to bring to audiences of all ages!

title: I Love Lucy | Lucy Thinks Ricky Is Trying to Murder Her
description:
Lucy cannot put down a murder mystery novel she is reading, which features a man who kills his wife to remarry. When Ethel tells Lucy's fortune with a deck of cards and predicts death in the future, Lucy fears that Ricky is planning to murder her--especially after she overhears Ricky talking about "replacing" a girl (actually one of the dancers in his show).

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. All 180 episodes aired on Mondays.

In total 180 episodes of I Love Lucy were produced, plus a pilot episode. The pilot, which was not made for broadcast and did not air as part of the show's original run, is generally not counted as one of the episodes and therefore listed separately for reference. It is, however, available on DVD and Blu-ray releases of the first season. Following I Love Lucy, a further 13 one hour-long episodes were produced under the title of The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show (later and more commonly known in syndication as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour) with the same cast and later packaged as seasons 7, 8 & 9 under the I Love Lucy series.

Follow us on"

The History:
Phi and Me TV was a Melbourne International Comedy Festival in 2011 with 4.5 star reviews and sell out season. In 2014, we crowdfunded $11k to start the process to create the first ever Vietnamese Australian Family comedy webseries in the world. In December 2017 we filmed the whole webseries in 7 days all in Springvale. In February 2018, we crowdfunded over $17k for post production, making the total $28k in total, and we knew it would not be enough for the quality we were dreaming of, so we applied for Screen Australia funding, and in April 2019, SA funded us $52k to finish the webseries.
We finally released the first ever series on June 16th 2019. Thank you to over 200 crowdfunders from all over the world. You made this happen.

title: From Budget Blues to Cash Craziness | Lucy's Wild Money-Making Adventure! | I Love Lucy
description:
In Season 4 Episode 1 of the beloved classic sitcom "I Love Lucy," titled "The Business Manager," Lucy finds herself in a financial predicament as she falls several months behind in paying the bills. Concerned about their financial stability, Ricky decides to hire a no-nonsense business manager to help get their finances in order.

As Lucy adjusts to the strict budget imposed by the business manager, her mischievous nature leads her to concoct a scheme to earn some extra cash. What follows is a hilarious series of escapades as Lucy's scheme takes unexpected turns, leaving her swimming in money but also facing the consequences of her actions.

Join Lucy, Ricky, Ethel, and Fred in this iconic episode filled with laughter, mishaps, and timeless comedic moments that have endeared "I Love Lucy" to audiences for generations.

Watch now to relive the classic moments and memorable antics that make "The Business Manager" a standout episode in television history!

title: The I Love Lucy Cast Hated Him More Than Anyone

Peel back the curtains and step onto the set of one of America's most beloved sitcoms, "I Love Lucy". In this video, we explore a lesser-known side of the classic show - the behind-the-scenes tensions and the personalities that drove them. While "I Love Lucy" offered an idyllic portrayal of 1950s America on-screen, the off-screen dynamics were far from perfect.

Our spotlight shines on William Frawley, the talented actor behind the gruff yet lovable character, Fred Mertz. Notorious for his difficult behavior and unreasonable demands, Frawley's interactions with his fellow cast members were often tense, marked by conflict, and overshadowed by his struggles with alcoholism. Despite these challenges, Frawley's performance remains an integral part of the enduring charm of "I Love Lucy."

Join us as we delve deep into Frawley's contentious relationships, his impact on the show, and how he was viewed by his fellow cast members. Discover how the off-screen drama contributed to the on-screen magic and the legacy of this iconic series. After discussing Frawleyâ€™s time on I Love Lucy, weâ€™ll then move on to addressing how the actor managed to regain the dignity that he felt he had lost while appearing on that series in his follow-up roles. If youâ€™re a fan of Frawley and I Love Lucy, this is one video that you wonâ€™t want to miss!

The I Love Lucy Cast Hated Him More Than Anyone

"I Love Lucy" is a classic American television sitcom that aired from 1951 to 1957. The show starred Lucille Ball as Lucy Ricardo, Desi Arnaz as her husband Ricky Ricardo, and their neighbors and best friends, Fred and Ethel Mertz, played by William Frawley and Vivian Vance.

The show is known for its pioneering role in television history, being one of the first to use a multi-camera setup in front of a live audience. It was also one of the first TV shows to be recorded on film, which allowed it to be rerun for decades, making it one of the most beloved and influential sitcoms of all time.

The series is famous for its physical comedy, particularly Lucy's antics, and includes many iconic episodes such as the "Vitameatavegamin" commercial, the grape-stomping scene, and the chocolate factory conveyor belt. "I Love Lucy" has left an enduring legacy and remains popular in syndication.

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. All 180 episodes aired on Mondays.

In total 180 episodes of I Love Lucy were produced, plus a pilot episode. The pilot, which was not made for broadcast and did not air as part of the show's original run, is generally not counted as one of the episodes and therefore listed separately for reference. It is, however, available on DVD and Blu-ray releases of the first season. Following I Love Lucy, a further 13 one hour-long episodes were produced under the title of The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show (later and more commonly known in syndication as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour) with the same cast and later packaged as seasons 7, 8 & 9 under the I Love Lucy series.

In this uproarious episode titled "The Matchmaker," Lucy Ricardo takes it upon herself to play cupid for her lonely friend, determined to orchestrate a marriage proposal from her hesitant boyfriend. However, when Ricky catches wind of Lucy's matchmaking scheme, he jumps into action to save the unsuspecting beau from the clutches of matrimony. What ensues is a riotous clash of intentions, as Lucy's romantic ambitions collide head-on with Ricky's attempts to avoid a marriage fiasco.

Join us on a journey back to the golden age of television comedy as we revisit the timeless antics of Lucy and Ricky Ricardo. From Lucy's hilarious schemes to Ricky's exasperated reactions, "The Matchmaker" delivers non-stop laughs and classic moments that have endeared audiences for generations. Whether it's Lucy's zany antics or Ricky's attempts to keep the peace, this episode is packed with unforgettable scenes and iconic one-liners that have become synonymous with the beloved series.

So grab your popcorn, settle in, and prepare to be entertained by one of the most beloved sitcoms of all time. Join us as we celebrate the timeless humor and enduring charm of "I Love Lucy" in "The Matchmaker" - an episode that proves love and laughter always go hand in hand. title: I Love Lucy | Little Ricky shows a natural talent for the drums
description:
When Little Ricky shows a natural talent for the drums, Lucy and Ricky clash over whether he should be a professional drummer when he grows up.

"I Love Lucy" is a classic American television sitcom that aired from 1951 to 1957. The show starred Lucille Ball as Lucy Ricardo, Desi Arnaz as her husband Ricky Ricardo, and their neighbors and best friends, Fred and Ethel Mertz, played by William Frawley and Vivian Vance.

The show is known for its pioneering role in television history, being one of the first to use a multi-camera setup in front of a live audience. It was also one of the first TV shows to be recorded on film, which allowed it to be rerun for decades, making it one of the most beloved and influential sitcoms of all time.

The series is famous for its physical comedy, particularly Lucy's antics, and includes many iconic episodes such as the "Vitameatavegamin" commercial, the grape-stomping scene, and the chocolate factory conveyor belt. "I Love Lucy" has left an enduring legacy and remains popular in syndication.

title: Regaining Grace | Ethel and Lucy's Charm School Adventure | I Love Lucy
description:
In this classic episode of "I Love Lucy," Ethel and Lucy find themselves feeling neglected by their husbands, Ricky and Fred, who seem more interested in other women's company. Frustrated and determined to regain their partners' attention, Ethel and Lucy devise a plan after observing how Ricky and Fred admire the grace and charm of a friend's date.

Join us as we dive into the hilarity and charm of Season 3, Episode 15, "The Charm School." Witness Ethel and Lucy's comedic antics as they enroll in charm school, hoping to win back their husbands' affections. From etiquette lessons to posture practice, the ladies embark on a whirlwind journey to become the epitome of elegance.

But will their newfound charm be enough to capture Ricky and Fred's hearts once again? Tune in as we explore the timeless humor and endearing moments that make "I Love Lucy" an enduring classic. Don't miss out on the laughter and heartwarming lessons in this iconic episode!

title: Scenes from I Love Lucy 'Fred and Ethel Fight' Colorized! (As seen in 'Being the Ricardos')
description:
Hello! In this video I colorized the scenes from 'Fred and Ethel Fight' that were seen in the movie 'Being the Ricardos'. I feel like comparing the scenes side by side with the movie is very interesting with the scenes now in color. One thing I did notice is that in the movie the apartment used is the Ricardo's second, while when the actual episode was filmed, they were still in their first apartment (you can tell by the window in the back). This colorization and all my videos are only possible due to support from viewers like you. You can support me at 'buymeacoffee.com/ross117'. See you all soon!

Note about Colorization: This video is colorized by me, not CBS. When CBS colorizes something, they take the time to go frame by frame. This video is colorized by artificial intelligence, and although it's gotten very good at pictures, it still has some ways to go with video. Because of this, I feel the colors look muted and very warm. In the future, I will continue to upload my I Love Lucy In Color Series (which is colorized by CBS and looks perfect) and will also upload my black and white best moment series (as there are way more episodes that are only in black and white then those colorized). When I upload a black and white video, I will upload a colorized version as well, it won't look amazing but think of it like a bonus.

title: "I Love Lucy" Philip Morris Advertisements/Sponsor Placement (1952)
description:
Lemme get this out of the way first: These commercials are being posted for historical purposes only, not as a condonation or advertisement for cigarette smoking. I do not condone, in anyway whatsoever, smoking tobacco products. Smoking's bullshit folks, and it's bad for ya. Just don't do it. Lemme also note that Dezi Arnez eventually died of lung cancer due to his smoking in 1986 at the age of 69, with Lucille Ball also dying a few years after due to an abdominal aneurysm, which her smoking increased her risk of. Make of that what you will.

However, these commercials and sponsor spots for Philip Morris Cigarettes from the I Love Lucy episodes "Job Switching" (aka that episode where Lucy and Vivian Vance fuck around at a candy factory) and Lucy Does a TV Commercial (aka that episode where Lucy gets drunk off of "Vitameatavegamin" while trying to film a commercial for it) are still a very interesting piece of television history, as it is basically an artifact from a different time, back when this type of blatant advertising for tobacco was not only present but commonplace in television, along with seeing a show just being soaked in sponsor placement, with, in this case, Philip Morris cartons or that annoying "CALL FOR PHILIP MORRIS" guy (fun fact: he was not a kid when these originally aired. He was 42) in the opening titles or the closing credits, along with Lucille Ball and Dezi Arnez smoking them. All of this seems just completely ludicrous to any of us who hasn't lived through this time, not even just the fact that it's all for fucking cigarettes, but seeing such blatant product placement period, while nowadays Geoff Keighley being surrounded by Mountain Dew and Doritos in a interview (remember that?) becomes a meme. But, that's what makes old cigarette commercials so fucking interesting. It's a fascinating slice of a very different era.

From the Criterion Television Classics LaserDisc release of I Love Lucy.

fair use anyone who takes this down is a smoker.
tags: Television History,I Love Lucy,Dezi Arnez,Lucille Ball,Vintage Commercials,1950s Commercials,Cigarette Commercials,1950s

title: I Love Lucy | Identical Gown Guffaws | Lucy and Ethel's Riotous Fashion Misadventure Exposed!
description:
Get ready to laugh until your sides hurt as Lucy and Ethel find themselves in yet another hilarious predicament in Season 3, Episode 3 of the timeless classic, "I Love Lucy."

In this uproarious episode, Lucy and Ethel, ever the dynamic duo, eagerly prepare for their upcoming appearance on a televised revue for their women's club. However, their excitement quickly turns to dismay when they discover that they've both unknowingly purchased identical gowns for the occasion!

Join Lucy and Ethel on a whirlwind adventure filled with laughter, mishaps, and miscommunications as they attempt to rectify the situation. With their signature charm and wit, Lucille Ball and Vivian Vance deliver unforgettable performances that will have you in stitches from start to finish.

As the duo concocts a plan to return the dresses and find new ones, chaos ensues, leading to a series of side-splitting misunderstandings that only Lucy and Ethel could find themselves in. Will they manage to pull off their performance without a hitch, or will their identical attire lead to even more comedic chaos?

Tune in to find out as Lucy and Ethel take center stage in a performance that's sure to leave you rolling on the floor with laughter. Don't miss a minute of the fun in this classic episode of "I Love Lucy" that showcases the timeless humor and enduring charm of television's favorite best friends.

Get ready to laugh, cry, and cheer as Lucy and Ethel prove once again that there's never a dull moment when they're around. It's a comedy of errors you won't want to miss! So grab your popcorn, gather your friends, and join us for a trip down memory lane with Lucy and Ethel in this unforgettable episode of "I Love Lucy."

description:
Welcome back to the uproarious world of "I Love Lucy"! In this side-splitting episode from Season 5, Episode 4 titled "Ricky Sells the Car," Lucy and the Mertzes find themselves in a whirlwind of chaos when Ricky makes a spur-of-the-moment decision to sell their car without consulting the rest of the gang. Panic ensues as Lucy, Ethel, and Fred realize they could be stranded in California indefinitely without their trusty mode of transportation.

Watch as Lucy devises ingenious schemes to prevent the car from being sold, leading to a series of comedic misunderstandings and misadventures. From Lucy's harebrained ideas to Fred's exasperated reactions and Ethel's attempts to keep the peace, every moment is filled with laughter and charm.

Join us for this timeless classic as we revisit the golden age of television comedy with Lucy, Ricky, Ethel, and Fred. Don't miss out on the hilarity that ensues when Ricky Sells the Car! Tune in now and prepare to laugh until your sides ache!

title: How the 27 Members of the I Love Lucy Cast Tragically Died?
description:
How the 27 Members of the I Love Lucy Cast Tragically Died?
Greetings, fellow viewers, and welcome to my channel! Here, you'll discover a curated selection of videos crafted with meticulous attention and passion. My focus revolves around producing content centered on television programs, specifically delving into the evolution of cast members from classic shows through the years. Additionally, I delve into the intricacies of real-life connections among cast members, both past and present.

Every day, I strive for continuous improvement and development in my content creation journey.

Should you have any concerns regarding copyright issues, please don't hesitate to contact me directly through Twitter or Facebook messaging. Upholding intellectual property rights is of utmost importance to me, and I commit to promptly addressing any valid copyright inquiries.

For any business-related matters, I invite you to reach out to me via direct message on Twitter. I'm enthusiastic about potential collaborations and partnerships that resonate with my creative direction.

Thank you for embarking on this adventure with me. I trust you'll find enjoyment in exploring the captivating realm of television shows through my videos.

-------------------------
Step back into the golden era of television and uncover the poignant, little-known stories behind the 27 members of the 'I Love Lucy' cast. While the show brought laughter and joy to millions, the real lives of its beloved actors were marked by unexpected and often tragic ends. From sudden, untimely deaths to long battles with illness, each member's story is a powerful reminder of the fragility of life behind the camera. Join us as we explore the heartbreaking fates that shadowed one of America's most iconic TV families, revealing the profound and often somber realities that contrast sharply with the show's enduring charm.

In this classic episode of "I Love Lucy" titled "Lucy Cries Wolf," Lucy Ricardo concocts a mischievous plan to put her husband Ricky's love to the test. Join us as we dive into the hilarious antics of Lucy as she fakes a crisis to gauge Ricky's affection for her.

As Lucy's scheme unfolds, viewers are treated to a rollercoaster of laughter and suspense as Ricky navigates through Lucy's fabricated drama. From exaggerated injuries to outlandish scenarios, Lucy pulls out all the stops to see if Ricky's love will withstand the test.

With iconic moments and unforgettable performances by Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz, this episode showcases the timeless humor and charm that made "I Love Lucy" a beloved classic. Join us as we revisit the laughter and heartwarming moments of this beloved sitcom favorite!

title: Lucy's Literary Mayhem | When Fiction Hits Too Close to Home! | I Love Lucy
description:
In this classic episode of I Love Lucy, Lucy Ricardo finds herself embarking on a literary adventure like no other! Season 3 Episode 24, "Lucy Writes a Novel," follows Lucy as she dives headfirst into the world of writing, only to stir up trouble with her hilariously thinly disguised characters.

As Lucy pens her novel, she draws inspiration from her own life and the colorful characters that surround her, much to the dismay of Ricky, Fred, and Ethel. What ensues is a riotous comedy of errors as Lucy's fictional portrayals hit a little too close to home, causing uproarious chaos and misunderstandings.

Join us as we dive into the comedic brilliance of Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz, unraveling the side-splitting antics that unfold when Lucy's imagination runs wild. From Ricky's exasperated reactions to Ethel and Fred's attempts to decipher their fictional counterparts, "Lucy Writes a Novel" is a timeless gem of television comedy that continues to leave audiences in stitches.

Don't miss out on the laughter and charm of one of I Love Lucy's most memorable episodes! Tune in for our recap and review as we celebrate the enduring legacy of Lucy Ricardo and her unforgettable escapades.

I Love Lucy | Lucy is worried that their unborn child will someday ask a lot of difficult questions
description:
Lucy is worried that their unborn child will someday ask a lot of difficult questions, so she hires a tutor to teach her, Ricky, and the Mertzes.

I Love Lucy is an American television sitcom starring Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Vivian Vance, and William Frawley. The black-and-white series originally ran from October 15, 1951, to May 6, 1957, on CBS. All 180 episodes aired on Mondays.

In total 180 episodes of I Love Lucy were produced, plus a pilot episode. The pilot, which was not made for broadcast and did not air as part of the show's original run, is generally not counted as one of the episodes and therefore listed separately for reference. It is, however, available on DVD and Blu-ray releases of the first season. Following I Love Lucy, a further 13 one hour-long episodes were produced under the title of The Lucille Ball-Desi Arnaz Show (later and more commonly known in syndication as The Lucyâ€“Desi Comedy Hour) with the same cast and later packaged as seasons 7, 8 & 9 under the I Love Lucy series.

title: Strike it Rich with Laughter | Oil Wells | I Love Lucy
description:
Step into the uproarious world of I Love Lucy with Season 3, Episode 18 - "Oil Wells". Lucy and her sidekick Ethel embark on a riotous adventure when they're approached by new neighbors claiming to be oil tycoons from Texas. In this classic episode, the gang takes a plunge into the world of oil stock investments, leading to a series of uproarious misunderstandings and mishaps.

Join us for a deep dive into the laughter-packed chaos of "Oil Wells" as we dissect Lucy's harebrained schemes, Ethel's unwavering loyalty, Ricky's exasperation, and Fred's deadpan humor. From the moment Lucy sets her sights on striking it rich to the unforgettable climax, this episode is a rollercoaster ride of comedy gold.

With its timeless humor and impeccable comic timing, "Oil Wells" remains a standout moment in television history. Don't miss our detailed breakdown of the iconic scenes, memorable quotes, and the brilliant performances that have made I Love Lucy a timeless classic. Grab your popcorn and join us for a trip down memory lane with Lucy, Ricky, Ethel, and Fred in this unforgettable episode!

title: I Love Lucy Goofs and Bloopers
description:
Funny I Love Lucy goofs and bloopers you may have missed in this video on the classic television comedy series of the 1950s. I Love Lucy had lots of bloopers and goofs that were left in to the final show. They didn't like to do scenes over again so many times they just went with it which made the episodes more fresh. It also insured that the audience reaction was more energetic. See Lucille Ball, William Frawley, and Desi Arnaz get involved in bloopers and goofs that sometimes involved their mistakes and sometimes involved problems with the cameras and props that were visible when they weren't supposed to be.

Also, in this video we look at Ricky Ricardo's magic hat, the fishing boat incident that feels like it happened near the Bermuda Triangle, the rigged car accident with Lucy and Ethel. See how Lucy ad libs to handle mistakes during scenes, and more.

title: Richie Cole - I Love Lucy
description: This is one of Richie Cole's most successful LPs. Four songs utilize the Manhattan Transfer; the great vocalese singer Eddie Jefferson (heard two weeks before his tragic death) makes his final record appearance; there are some good solos by pianist Dick Hindman and guitarist Bruce Forman; and Tom Waits makes an eccentric guest appearance. But it is altoist Cole who stars throughout on an unlikely program highlighted by boppish versions of such tunes as "Hooray for Hollywood," "Hi-Fly," "Relaxin' at Camarillo," "I Love Lucy," and his original "Tokyo Rose Sings the Hollywood Blues." A gem.

title: I Love Lucy | Lucy's Baby Blues & Neighbor Spat | No Children Allowed!
description:
ðŸ“º Join Lucy and Ricky Ricardo in another classic episode of "I Love Lucy," where parenting woes take center stage! In Season 2, Episode 22, titled "No Children Allowed," Lucy faces the ultimate challenge as Little Ricky decides it's the perfect night for non-stop crying. The chaos unfolds when the nosy neighbor, Mrs. Trumbull, raises the stakes, claiming the lease forbids children.

ðŸ‘¶ Watch as Lucy's comedic genius shines through her attempts to soothe Little Ricky, all while Ethel rallies to support her dear friends. Will the Ricardos be forced to pack their bags, or can Lucy's charm and wit save the day? Find out in this uproarious episode filled with laughter, misunderstandings, and a dash of neighborly drama.

ðŸ¤£ Ethel Mertz, the ever-reliable best friend, comes to the rescue, challenging Mrs. Trumbull's claims and proving that the power of friendship can triumph over strict lease agreements. Will the Ricardos emerge victorious in this battle against eviction?

ðŸŽ‰ Don't miss this iconic episode that showcases Lucille Ball's unmatched comedic timing and the enduring charm of "I Love Lucy." Join us for a trip down memory lane and relive the hilarious moments that make this classic sitcom an everlasting favorite.
